intro: Stackhousia spathulata f. maculata, commonly known as the spotted stackhousia, is a rare and ornamental plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its unique, clustered inflorescences. The foliage features distinctive spots or markings, giving it its common name. The plant produces vibrant, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as birds and insects. Due to its rarity and horticultural value, it is often cultivated in specialized gardens and botanical collections.
